alert.note: Alert for Denton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 10:29AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Denton, Tarrant and northern Dallas Counties through 1115 AM CDT... At 1028 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Flower Mound to Fort Worth. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dallas, Fort Worth, Arlington, Garland, Irving, Grand Prairie, Carrollton, Denton, Richardson, Lewisville, Flower Mound, Mansfield, Rowlett, Euless, Bedford, Grapevine, Haltom City, Keller, Coppell and Hurst. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35W between mile markers 43 and 79. Interstate 35E between mile markers 428 and 454. Interstate 20 between mile markers 435 and 458. Interstate 30 between mile markers 9 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
